contentList.content: Legend states that the dragovian race came into being due to a curse meant to maim Bahamut during an ancient war with Tiamat. When the curse was aimed at Bahamut one of the Great Gold Wyrm's, Kuraenixia the Presence, took the curse instead, however, the magic was so great that it bounced upon many of the other combatants. This curse over time diminished the dragons size and power until they were similar in size and stature to that of humans and elves.
The name of the dragovians as awarded to them by their dragon breatheren. True to their name, which translates to "Dragon Soul," they embody the might of dragonkind in all that they do.

Named for their ancestral ties to the gargantuans of the deep, these dragovians are aquatic wonders that are rarely seen on land. They guide the Sea-Forged on their journey across the the ocean, sometimes joining them on grand adventures throughout realmspace.

"Burn bright in the maker's fire." An ancient creed of the reforged dragovians; these words call to the iron engraved into their scales, vibrating with the magic of Dwemer smithwork. For the Kovgam, life is only as valuable as path forged ahead; the metal in their flesh a reminder that action is the law that governs the planes of existance.

Not all dragovians were pleased with their lot in life after Tiamat cursed their kin. Some turned to death and saw an embrace; a mighty necrosis seeping into their scales and gripping their flesh. Possessed by this otherworldly madness, the Nurnelith seek the whispers from the void in a never ending bid for release from their mortal coil.
Ignite your foes with a flaming projectile from your gaping maw. Explodes on contact.
Freeze your foes with a frosty projectile from your gaping maw. Explodes on contact.
Electrocute your foes with a high voltage projectile from your gaping maw. Explodes on contact.
Corrupt your foe's blood with a noxious projectile from your gaping maw. Explodes on contact.
Engage the skies gracefully with your wings. Only available out of combat.
Your blood calls for deeper understanding of the world around you. Gain Advantage on Wisdom and Intelligence rolls.
When submerged in water, gain Advantage on Attack Rolls.
Clad in Dwemer Iron across your skin, your AC is set to 10 and is boosted by your Strength and Constitution modifiers. Must not be wearing Armor or a Shield.
Constant reinforcement of your stitching has made you more durable. Increase armor class by 1.
Harness the Dwemer enchantment in your iron skin; your armor class increases by 3.
Armor class has been increased by 3.
Necrotic energies spill from your gaping maw. Explodes on contact.

You have learned to weave your wicked charm into your breath attack. Increase the damage of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_BreathWeapon_Necrotic_Dragovian">Festering Breath</LSTag> by your Charisma modifier.

You have learned to weave your warped thoughts into your breath attack. Increase the damage of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_BreathWeapon_Necrotic_Dragovian">Festering Breath</LSTag> by your Intelligence modifier.

You have learned to weave your cursed morals into your breath attack. Increase the damage of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_BreathWeapon_Necrotic_Dragovian">Festering Breath</LSTag> by your Wisdom modifier.

Should <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_BreathWeapon_Necrotic_Dragovian">Festering Breath</LSTag> critically strike, foes will be <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_NecroShove">forceably shoved</LSTag> by the resulting blast.
Shove all targets back from the resulting blast.
The wounds of your foe spur you on to finish the job. Deal an extra 1d4 of melee or ranged weapon damage to foes with less than full health.
Select how you would like to experience flight.
Select an option from an assortment of draconic elemental attacks.
